Article.Abstract: To understand and develop strategies to intervene in autoimmune responses to myelin proteolipid protein (PLP), encephalitogenic epitopes must be identified. To expedite the identification of potentially immunogenic and encephalitogenic epitopes of PLP, overlapping synthetic 20-mer PLP peptides covering the whole PLP molecule were screened for their ability to bind to purified mouse I-Ad, I-Ak, and I-As molecules. The peptides that bound to the I-A molecules were tested for their ability to induce immune responses in corresponding inbred mouse strains. Immunogenic peptides were then tested for their ability to induce experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis. Moderate to strong I-A binding was essential for development of immune responses, but immunogenicity was not sufficient for encephalitogenicity. Rather, encephalitogenic epitopes clustered in three regions of the molecule, namely within residues 40-70, 100-119, and 178-209. These were also the regions of the PLP that showed the greatest promiscuity in binding to I-A molecules. Except for PLP 139-151, which is an encephalitogenic determinant in mice expressing I-As, all encephalitogenic epitopes of PLP previously identified, regardless of their MHC class II restriction, are located within or adjacent to these epitope clusters. None of the encephalitogenic epitopes occur in regions of the molecule that have a high degree of homology with the neuronal M6a protein, a member of the DM20/PLP superfamily. Atypical clinical and histologic patterns of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis were observed in some strains of mice sensitized with certain PLP peptides and may reflect induction of T cells with different disease-inducing potentials.
Article.ArticleTitle: Immunogenic and encephalitogenic epitope clusters of myelin proteolipid protein.
Article.Affiliations: Biomedical Sciences Division, E.K. Shriver Center, Waltham MA 02254, USA.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Histocompatibility Antigens Class II;Immunodominant Epitopes;Myelin Proteolipid Protein;Peptides
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Encephalomyelitis, Autoimmune, Experimental(etiology; immunology; pathology); Female; Histocompatibility Antigens Class II(metabolism); Immunodominant Epitopes(chemistry; immunology; toxicity); Lymphocyte Activation; Mice; Mice, Inbred A; Mice, Inbred AKR; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Mice, Inbred C3H; Mice, Inbred C57BL; Mice, Inbred CBA; Mice, Inbred DBA; Molecular Sequence Data; Myelin Proteolipid Protein(chemistry; immunology; toxicity); Peptides(immunology); Protein Binding(immunology); Species Specificity

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Pooled lymph node cells (LNC) were prepared from inguinal and axillary lymph nodes from mice injected 9 days earlier with 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from BALB/cPt mice immunized with the epitope failed to proliferate in response to the same peptide.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Pooled lymph node cells (LNC) were prepared from inguinal and axillary lymph nodes from mice injected 9 days earlier with 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from mice immunized with the epitope failed to proliferate in response to the same peptide. This correlated with I-As MHC binding data.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope to induce EAE was tested in SJL/J (0/6) and B10.S (0/3) mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from mice immunized with the epitope proliferated in response to the same peptide. This correlated with I-As MHC binding data.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope to induce EAE was tested in SJL/J (2/6) and B10.S (0/3) mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Pooled lymph node cells (LNC) were prepared from inguinal and axillary lymph nodes from mice injected 9 days earlier with 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from mice immunized with the epitope proliferated in response to the same peptide. This correlated with I-As MHC binding data.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with 100ug of whole human PLP emulsified in 400ug M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) plus 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis. Lymph node cells were removed 9 days after the injection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from mice immunized with human PLP failed to proliferate in response to the epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA/J, A/J, AKR/J and C3HeB/FcJ mice immunized with the epitope proliferated in response to the same peptide. C3H/HeJ were negative.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope to induce EAE was tested in mice. Other I-Ak mice tested (A/J, AKR/J,CBA/J and C3H/HeJ) were negative.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope to induce EAE was tested in BALB/cPt (3/5) and BALB/cJ (2/7) mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Pooled lymph node cells (LNC) were prepared from inguinal and axillary lymph nodes from mice injected 9 days earlier with 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from BALB/cPt mice immunized with the epitope proliferated in response to the same peptide. This peptide was also positive in BALB/cJ mice, but not DBA/2 mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Pooled lymph node cells (LNC) were prepared from inguinal and axillary lymph nodes from mice injected 9 days earlier with 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from mice immunized with the epitope failed to proliferate in response to the same peptide. This correlated with I-As MHC binding data.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope to induce EAE was tested in mice. This included A/J, AKR/J, CBA/J, C3H/HeJ and C3HeB/FcJ mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Pooled lymph node cells (LNC) were prepared from inguinal and axillary lymph nodes from mice injected 9 days earlier with 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from BALB/cPt mice immunized with the epitope proliferated in response to the same peptide. This peptide was also positive in BALB/cJ mice, but not DBA/2 mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Pooled lymph node cells (LNC) were prepared from inguinal and axillary lymph nodes from mice injected 9 days earlier with 100ug PLP peptide in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from mice immunized with the epitope proliferated in response to the same peptide. This correlated with I-As MHC binding data.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope to induce EAE was tested in BALB/cPt and BALB/cJ mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope to induce EAE was tested in SJL/J mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with 100ug of whole human PLP emulsified in 400ug M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) plus 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis. Lymph node cells were removed 9 days after the injection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from mice immunized with human PLP failed to proliferate in response to the epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to cause disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100ug PLP peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were injected in the flank with 100ug of peptide plus 400ug of M. tuberculosis (H37Ra) in an emulsion consisting of equal parts water and CFA. Mice were then injected on days 0 and 3 with 4.5x10<sup>9</sup> Bordatella pertussis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope to induce EAE was tested in SJL/J mice.
